## General Information {.smaller visibility="uncounted"}

- **Course**: An Introduction to the R Language
- **Instructors**: Daniel Vartanian
- **Place**: Laboratory 122, School of Philosophy, Letters and Human Sciences ([FFLCH](https://www.fflch.usp.br/)), University of São Paulo ([USP](https://www5.usp.br/)).
- **Dates**: 02/02 to 06/02/2026
- **Time**: 10:00 to 17:00
- **Duration**: 30 hours

::: {.notes}
:::

## Learning Objectives {.smaller visibility="uncounted"}

1. Understand foundational principles and key concepts of programming
1. Learn the structure and essential components of the R programming language
1. Master fundamental techniques for data cleaning and transformation
1. Develop skills in creating effective data visualizations
1. Apply techniques for conducting exploratory data analysis
1. Build introductory statistical and predictive models

::: {.notes}
:::

## Theoretical Basis {.smaller visibility="uncounted"}

1. Dialectical materialism [@engels2020a].
1. Cultural-historical theory [@vygotsky2012a].
1. Pedagogy of autonomy/Dialectal pedagogy [@freire2011].
1. Dialectical unity in pedagogical activity [@bernardes2009a].

::: {.notes}
:::

## The Unit of Pedagogical Activity {.smaller visibility="uncounted"}

::: {style="font-size: 0.7em; padding-top: 30px;"}
|                                      | Teaching Activity (Teacher)       | Learning Activity (Student)       |
|--------------------------------------|----------------------------------|----------------------------------|
| **Motive/Need**                      | Enable the transformation of students' constitution through access to culture — humanizing them. | Become an heir to culture — humanizing oneself. |
| **Objective**                        | Teach socio-historical knowledge. | Appropriate socio-historical knowledge. |
| **Actions and Operations**           | **Organizing teaching:**<br>- Defining the knowledge to be taught (*What*).<br>- Defining the conditions (modes of action) in which the knowledge will be taught (*How*). | - Execute study tasks.<br>- Perform study activities.<br>- Participate in control and evaluation actions. |
:::

::: footer
[@bernardes2009a, Translated from Portuguese to English by the author]
:::

## Strategy {.smaller visibility="uncounted"}

- Theory followed by practice
- In-class activities
- Data science exercise at the end of the course
- No formal evaluation
- Pre-course survey
- Post-course survey

## Resources {.smaller visibility="uncounted"}

- Whiteboard
- Data projector
- Slides
- Computers
